# Copilot Instructions for NATS WebSocket Bridge

This document provides context and guidelines for GitHub Copilot when working on this repository.

## Project Overview

This repository contains a WebSocket bridge for NATS, a cloud-native messaging system. The bridge enables WebSocket clients to communicate with NATS messaging servers.

## Coding Standards

- Write clean, readable, and well-documented code
- Follow existing code patterns and conventions in the repository
- Include meaningful comments for complex logic
- Use descriptive variable and function names

## Testing Requirements

- Write unit tests for new functionality
- Ensure existing tests pass before submitting changes
- Include integration tests when modifying bridge connectivity logic

## Pull Request Guidelines

- Keep changes focused and atomic
- Provide clear descriptions of what changes accomplish
- Reference related issues in PR descriptions
- Ensure all CI checks pass before requesting review

## Documentation

- Update README.md when adding new features or changing usage
- Document API changes and configuration options
- Include examples for new functionality
